Loss-of-function variants in ABCA7, including rs3764650, increase AD susceptibility. ABCA7 regulates lipid homeostasis and affects amyloid processing in the brain.
Variants in SORL1 such as rs11218343 influence APP trafficking and processing. SORL1 dysfunction leads to increased amyloid-beta production and Alzheimer disease risk.

Loss-of-function mutations in progranulin gene GRN cause frontotemporal dementia and certain variants like rs5848 modify Alzheimer disease risk through inflammatory pathways.
ADAM10 is the major alpha-secretase for APP. Variants such as rs593742 that enhance ADAM10 activity reduce amyloid-beta production and AD risk.

African American populations show unique AD risk loci including variants in ABCA7 at rs115550680 and novel associations not observed in European populations.
Asian populations demonstrate distinct genetic architecture for AD with population-specific associations at loci including SHARPIN rs34173062 and different APOE effect sizes.
Variants in BDNF at rs6265 and COMT at rs4680 modify the rate of cognitive decline in Alzheimer disease patients independent of primary disease risk.
